messages.subject: Re:Name, was Live Free, Learn Free
messages.msgSnippet: ... your name. ... it...so she ended up Alyssa Jade. ... Thanks, Nicole. It s not my real name though. Just a self choosen one. Dh and i actually wanted to
messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, Nicole Willoughby
<cncnawilloughby@...> wrote:
>
> Ok Im sorry this is totaly OT ....but Lilith I have to say I love
your name.
>
> I wanted to name our 3rd Lilith Rowan but dh wouldnt go for
it...so she ended up Alyssa Jade.
>
> Nicole

Thanks, Nicole. It's not my real name though. Just a self choosen one.
Dh and i actually wanted to name our daughter Lilith Rain, but so far
i have three boys and no little girl, so i've kind of adopted it for
myself over time. I do feel a strong attachment to the archetype.

Lilith

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: Live Free, Learn Free
messages.msgSnippet: Ok Im sorry this is totaly OT ....but Lilith I have to say I love your name. I wanted to name our 3rd Lilith Rowan but dh wouldnt go for it...so she ended up
messages.messageBody:
Ok Im sorry this is totaly OT ....but Lilith I have to say I love your name.

I wanted to name our 3rd Lilith Rowan but dh wouldnt go for it...so she ended up Alyssa Jade.

Nicole


---------------------------------
Stay in the know. Pulse on the new Yahoo.com. Check it out.

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: Live Free, Learn Free
messages.msgSnippet: ... Great! I ll check them all out. Dh doesn t have very many at home hours during the week, so he s always walking around the house with a magazine instead of
messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "Ren Allen"
<starsuncloud@...> wrote:
>
> "These are my three unschooling 'zines, fwiw."
>
> I adore all three. I've not written anything for Life Learning
> yet...but maybe I'll do that sometime. I think Shayna does a great
> job with LFLF and she's also a very nice person (online anyway, I've
> never met her irl).
>
> Danielle is doing an amazing job with "Connections", I've been very
> impressed!
>
> Ren
> learninginfreedom.com
>
Great! I'll check them all out. Dh doesn't have very many at home
hours during the week, so he's always walking around the house with a
magazine instead of a book. I thought subscribing might be a good way
to get him more informed about the practices of unschooling than
handing him a book. I'll read them too, of coarse, but i get plenty of
book time as well. I would really like to get Rue Kream's book soon,
which i've heard everyone speak so highly about.

Lilith

messages.subject: Live Free, Learn Free
messages.msgSnippet: These are my three unschooling zines, fwiw. I adore all three. I ve not written anything for Life Learning yet...but maybe I ll do that sometime.  I think
messages.messageBody:
"These are my three unschooling 'zines, fwiw."

I adore all three. I've not written anything for Life Learning
yet...but maybe I'll do that sometime. I think Shayna does a great
job with LFLF and she's also a very nice person (online anyway, I've
never met her irl).

Danielle is doing an amazing job with "Connections", I've been very
impressed!

Ren
learninginfreedom.com

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Live Free, Learn Free
messages.msgSnippet: ... Love it! Several of us have written for it, and Shana does a tremendous job. Well worth subscribing to, imo. I also love _Life Learning_ and have written
messages.messageBody:
lilith_pouia wrote:

> Just curious, has anyone read Live Free, Learn Free magazine? I've
> never heard of it and just came across it on google. Any opinions,
> impressions from anyone who has read it?
>

Love it! Several of us have written for it, and Shana does a tremendous
job. Well worth subscribing to, imo.

I also love _Life Learning_ and have written for that magazine as well.

Several of us here are also writing for the new ezine *Connections:
ezine of unschooling and mindful parenting* at
http://connections.organiclearning.org

These are my three unschooling 'zines, fwiw.


--
~~Danielle
Emily (9), Julia (7), Sam (6)
http://www.organiclearning.blogspot.com

~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*

Connections: ezine of unschooling and mindful parenting
http://connections.organiclearning.org

messages.subject: Re: Live Free, Learn Free
messages.msgSnippet: ... I LOVE LOVE LOVE this magazine...no curriculum ads, many personal stories by unschoolers about how unschooling works in thier families, and has a resource
messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "lilith_pouia"
<lilith_pouia@...> wrote:
>
> Just curious, has anyone read Live Free, Learn Free magazine? I've
> never heard of it and just came across it on google. Any opinions,
> impressions from anyone who has read it?
>
> Lilith
>
I LOVE LOVE LOVE this magazine...no curriculum ads, many personal
stories by unschoolers about how unschooling works in thier families,
and has a resource column about neat books, websites, as well as
families sharing something special their family does...this last issue
was geocaching. I would highly recommend it! Another good mag is
Life Learning Magazine.

Tina

messages.subject: Live Free, Learn Free

messages.messageBody:
Just curious, has anyone read Live Free, Learn Free magazine? I've
never heard of it and just came across it on google. Any opinions,
impressions from anyone who has read it?

Lilith
